name: PM Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
description: Financial support of ₹6000/year for eligible farmer families.
benefits: ₹6000 per year credited directly to the bank account

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: Insurance coverage and financial help in crop failure due to natural calamities.
benefits: Coverage for natural calamities, pests & diseases
Claims settled directly into bank accounts
eligibility: Farmers with crop loans automatically covered

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
description: Provides short-term loans to farmers at low interest rate.

name: PM Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
description: Ensures water availability and promotes micro irrigation.
benefits: Subsidy for drip & sprinkler irrigation systems

name: National Agriculture Market (e-NAM)
description: Online trading platform for transparent crop selling at fair prices.

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Provides soil nutrient status and fertilizer recommendations to farmers.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PMKMY)
description: Monthly pension of ₹3000 to farmers after 60 years.

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
description: Funding support to improve agriculture production and farming systems.

name: Gramin Bhandaran Yojana
description: Provides subsidy for building warehouses and cold storage.
benefits: Subsidy up to 33% for warehouse construction

name: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme (DEDS)
description: Supports dairy farmers for cattle purchase and dairy setup.
benefits: Subsidy up to 33% for dairy units

name: National Livestock Mission (NLM)
description: Improves livestock productivity & provides financial support.
benefits: Subsidy for poultry, goat & sheep farming

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Financial support for building post-harvest infrastructure.
benefits: Loan subsidy for farm equipment & storage

name: Mukhya Mantri Kisan Mitra Energy Yojana
description: Subsidy on electricity bills for agricultural power connections.

name: Bangla Shasya Bima Yojana
description: Free crop insurance scheme for West Bengal farmers.

name: Mukhya Mantri Kisan Aay Badhotri Yojana
description: Scheme focused on increasing farmers’ income through crop diversification and technological assistance.
benefits: Financial assistance for new crop adoption
Training and modern farming equipment support
Encourages farmers to shift to profitable crops

name: Mukhya Mantri Krishi Udyog Yojana
description: Financial subsidy for setting up agriculture-based industries.
benefits: Subsidy up to 50% for agro industries
Encourages food processing and value addition

name: Mukhya Mantri Beej Swavalamban Yojana
description: Subsidy on high-quality seeds to farmers.

name: Mukhya Mantri Solar Pump Yojana
description: Provides solar-powered pumps to farmers for irrigation.
benefits: Subsidy up to 70% for solar pumps

name: Sub Mission on Agriculture Mechanization (SMAM)
description: Financial support for purchase of farm machinery.
benefits: Up to 50% subsidy on tractors & equipment
eligibility: Special subsidy for SC/ST & women farmers

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
description: Financial support for promoting organic farming clusters.

name: National Mission on Horticulture
description: Support for fruit, vegetable & flower crop development.

name: Blue Revolution – Fisheries & Aquaculture
description: Promotes fisheries infrastructure & training support.

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
description: Provides irrigation facilities to farmland and promotes water-use efficiency.

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: Insurance scheme to protect farmers from crop losses due to natural disasters.

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Provides soil health status reports and fertilizer recommendations.

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
description: Provides easy and low-interest credit for farming activities.
benefits: Loan up to ₹3 lakh at low interest

name: National Beekeeping & Honey Mission
description: Support to beekeepers for honey production and marketing.

name: PM Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PM-FME)
description: Supports small food processing businesses and FPOs.

name: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme (DEDS)
description: Financial assistance for establishing dairy units.

name: National Livestock Mission
description: Supports livestock development, breed improvement, and feed management.

name: Rashtriya Gokul Mission
description: Improves indigenous cattle breeds for increased productivity.

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Provides subsidized loans for building warehouses and cold storage.

name: Kisan Drone Subsidy Scheme
description: Subsidy for drone purchase for pesticide spraying and crop monitoring.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PM-KMY)
description: Monthly pension scheme for farmers after age 60.

name: PM‑KISAN Samman Nidhi
description: Direct income support to small and marginal landholding farmer families.
benefits: Annual financial assistance (₹6,000 per year in instalments)
Helps meet input costs like seeds, fertiliser, labour
eligibility: Subject to land records and eligibility criteria in their state

name: PM‑KUSUM (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthaan Mahabhiyan)
description: Promotes use of solar energy for irrigation pumps and supports setting up solar plants on barren/fallow land of farmers.
benefits: Subsidy for solar pumps or solarising existing diesel/grid pumps
Opportunity to set up grid-connected solar plants (on own barren/fallow land)
Reduced electricity/diesel cost and additional income by selling power

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
description: Encourages organic farming through cluster-based organic cultivation, certification and market linkage support.
benefits: Financial aid for organic farming clusters
Training and guidance for organic methods
Better market access for organic produce

name: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market)
description: Online trading platform to integrate mandis (agricultural markets) across India — helps farmers get better pricing and transparency.
benefits: Access to a pan-India online marketplace for sale of produce
More transparent price discovery, reduced middlemen
Potential for better income via competitive bidding
eligibility: Farmers selling produce at mandis participating in e-NAM
Those registered with required mandi/market channels

name: Sub‑Mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM)
description: Provides financial assistance to farmers for purchasing agricultural machinery to improve farm productivity and reduce labour dependency.
benefits: Subsidy on tractors, tillers, harvesters, seed drills, and other machinery
Access to custom hiring centres for small/marginal farmers
Reduces labour costs and improves timeliness of farm operations
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers, SC/ST and women farmers get higher subsidy
documents: Application form via DBT or state portal

name: Formation and Promotion of 10,000 Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs)
description: Supports the formation of Farmer Producer Organisations (FPOs) to enable farmers to collectively access credit, markets, and infrastructure.
benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹18 lakh for 3 years per FPO
Equity grant for individual farmer members
Better access to loans, storage, processing, and market linkages
eligibility: Group of farmers forming an FPO
Minimum members: ~300 in plains, 100 in hilly/NE regions

name: Operation Greens
description: Supports tomato, onion, and potato (TOP) farmers with price stabilization, storage, and processing infrastructure.
benefits: Financial support for storage, transportation, and processing of TOP crops
Stabilizes prices and ensures fair income for farmers
eligibility: Growers of tomato, onion, and potato
FPOs, cooperatives, producer groups involved in TOP crops
documents: Project plan for value addition / storage / processing

name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
description: Aims to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, and commercial crops through improved technology and input support.
benefits: Improved seeds, fertilizers, and technical guidance
Focus on crop diversification and yield enhancement
Financial support for demonstration plots and adoption of technology
eligibility: All farmers growing target crops in notified districts

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
description: Supports holistic development of agriculture and allied sectors with flexible fund allocation to states for crop and infrastructure development.
benefits: Funds for improved seeds, irrigation, farm equipment
Support for agri-infrastructure and extension services
Promotes crop diversification and productivity enhancement
eligibility: Farmers and state agriculture departments implementing projects

name: National Horticulture Mission (NHM)
description: Promotes holistic growth of horticulture sector through technology, quality planting material, and marketing support.
benefits: Subsidy for nursery plants, irrigation, and protected cultivation
eligibility: FPOs or farmer groups in horticulture sector

name: National Mission on Oilseeds and Oil Palm (NMOOP)
description: Aims to increase area and production of oilseeds and oil palm through technology, subsidy, and extension support.
eligibility: Farmers cultivating oilseeds or oil palm

name: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme (DEDS)
description: Financial assistance for establishing dairy units and supporting dairy infrastructure.

name: National Livestock Mission (NLM)
description: Supports livestock development, breed improvement, and feed management.
benefits: Subsidy for poultry, goat, and cattle farming
Financial support for breed improvement programs
Training and skill development for farmers
eligibility: SHGs and FPOs involved in livestock

name: Rashtriya Gokul Mission
description: Improves indigenous cattle breeds for increased productivity and supports cattle development centers.

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Provides loans and financial assistance for setting up farm storage, warehouses, cold storage, and supply chain infrastructure.
benefits: Support for storage, logistics, and marketing infrastructure

name: Kisan Drone Subsidy Scheme
description: Subsidy for drone purchase for pesticide spraying, crop monitoring, and other precision agriculture applications.
benefits: Up to 50% subsidy on drones for farmers
75% subsidy for SC/ST and women farmers
Promotes modern technology adoption in agriculture

name: National Mission on Natural Farming (NMNF)
description: Promotes chemical‑free farming, biodiversity, soil health and climate‑resilient agriculture through natural farming methods.
benefits: Reduces dependency on chemical fertilisers and pesticides
Healthier soil, better resilience to climate stress, sustainable farming
eligibility: Willing Gram Panchayats / clusters for implementation
apply_link: Through state agriculture / NMNF portal as notified

name: Rajasthan Govardhan Jaivik Urvarak Yojana
description: Subsidy for producing organic manure/fertilizer — supports organic farming and reduces cost of chemical fertilisers.
benefits: Subsidy up to 50% or fixed amount for making organic manure
eligibility: Farmers in Rajasthan producing organic manure
Small/marginal farmers, as per state norms
apply_link: Through Rajasthan Agriculture Department / Raj‑Kisan Sathi portal

name: Fawara Sanyantra Yojana
description: Subsidy for installing sprinkler (fountain) irrigation systems to save water and improve irrigation efficiency.
benefits: Efficient water use and higher productivity
eligibility: Who have ≥ 0.2 hectares irrigated agricultural land
apply_link: Through Rajasthan Agriculture Dept / concerned irrigation branch

name: Drip Sanyantr Scheme (Rajasthan)
description: Subsidy for installing drip‑irrigation systems to conserve water and increase irrigation efficiency in dry and semi‑arid regions.
benefits: Subsidy 70–75% for drip‑irrigation equipment (for general / small‑marginal/SC‑ST & women farmers respectively)
Better water‑use efficiency, suitable for Rajasthan’s climate
Improved yield and reduced water waste
eligibility: Land up to 5 hectares (as per scheme norms)
apply_link: Through state agriculture / irrigation department portals

name: Mukhyamantri Beej Swavalamban Yojana
description: Distribution of seed‑mini kits to farmers to encourage self‑reliance and secure quality seeds for sowing.
benefits: Subsidised seed kits distributed by state government
Better seed quality and enhanced productivity
Helps small/marginal farmers access good seed at low cost
eligibility: Farmers in Rajasthan (small/marginal / all categories as per state notification)
apply_link: Through Rajasthan Agriculture Department / related portal

name: Tarbandi Subsidy Yojana
description: Subsidy for bunding / land‑levelling / soil‑conservation measures to protect fields from erosion, water runoff and to retain soil fertility.
benefits: Supports construction of field bunds, levelling and soil conservation works
Helps maintain land health, avoids soil erosion/water loss
Beneficial for marginal lands, uneven terrain
apply_link: Through Rajasthan Agriculture Department / state scheme portal

name: Mukhyamantri Pashu Bima Yojana
description: Subsidised animal‑insurance / livestock support scheme for livestock keepers to help with veterinary, health and insurance for animals.
benefits: Reduced cost of veterinary support / medicines
Encourages livestock farming along with agriculture
status: Active (beneficiaries doubled in 2025–26 state budget update)

name: Pashudhan Nishulk Arogya Yojana
description: Free/ subsidised veterinary services and medicines for livestock — veterinary sub‑centres to be set up in village panchayats for better animal health support.
benefits: Access to veterinary care, medicines, vaccinations for animals
Support for rural farmers rearing animals
eligibility: Livestock owners in designated rural/ village panchayats
apply_link: Through Rajasthan animal‑husbandry / veterinary services dept

name: Farm‑Pond & Water‑Storage Subsidy Scheme (State‑level — Rajasthan)
description: Subsidy and support for farmers to dig farm‑ponds, diggis (small water reservoirs) and install water‑storage structures to store rain or canal water for irrigation, especially for dry seasons.
benefits: Helps store water for irrigation during lean / dry seasons
Improved water security for semi‑arid / rainfall‑reliant farms
Reduces risk of crop failure due to water shortage
eligibility: As per state notification (land/ farm requirement & size limits)
apply_link: Through state agriculture / water‑resource department / notified portal
status: Active (recent budget mentions large allocation for farm‑ponds & solar pumps)

name: Pradhan Mantri Dhan‑Dhaanya Krishi Yojana
description: A scheme (2025) aimed at boosting productivity, irrigation, storage and allied infrastructure in selected agri‑districts across India (including some districts in Rajasthan).
benefits: Support for irrigation, micro‑irrigation, storage and logistics infrastructure
Credit and infrastructure support in backward / low‑productivity districts
eligibility: Farmers in selected districts / regions (as per scheme inclusion list, including few Rajasthan districts)
apply_link: Through Agriculture Ministry / district agriculture offices (after notification)
state: Designated States (including some districts in Rajasthan)

name: Modified Interest Subvention Scheme (MISS)
description: Provides concessional short‑term agri‑loans for crop husbandry, animal husbandry, dairying, fisheries — with subsidised interest and subvention benefit for prompt repayment.
benefits: Lower interest rate loans (effectively ~4% per annum after subvention)
Helps small/marginal farmers get crop loans affordably
Available for crop production, allied farming, post‑harvest loans
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers needing short‑term loans
documents: KCC application / bank account / Aadhaar / land record as required
apply_link: Through scheduled banks offering agricultural credit (as per scheme guidelines)

name: Market Intervention Scheme & Price Support Scheme (MIS‑PSS)
description: Provides price support / procurement or minimum support when market prices fall below economic thresholds — for pulses, oilseeds, perishable & horticultural produce in certain conditions.
benefits: Prevents distress sale and major losses for farmers
Assures minimum support price or compensation when market price crashes
Stabilises farm income for vulnerable crops
eligibility: Farmers / producers of covered commodities (pulses, oilseeds, perishable crops) in notified areas
As per scheme specification and market intervention notification
documents: Crop/produce registration & sale receipt, farmer identity (Aadhaar / land record), mandi‑registration if any
apply_link: Through nodal agencies / notified procurement centres or state / central agriculture departments
state: All India (subject to crop & area notification)

name: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)
description: Promotes horticulture (fruits, vegetables, flowers, spices), helps with nursery plants, post‑harvest infra, cold storage, marketing support, to increase income diversification and reduce risk.
benefits: Subsidy for orchard/ nursery establishment, protected cultivation, irrigation, post‑harvest facilities
Improved market access and reduced post‑harvest losses
eligibility: Farmers or horticulture‑farmers, FPOs / groups involved in horticulture, as per guidelines
Interested in horticulture / vegetable / fruit / flower cultivation
documents: Aadhaar, land / farm record, project proposal (if required), bank account
apply_link: Through state horticulture / agriculture departments / MIDH portal

name: National Agriculture Market (e-NAM) — enhanced mandi integration
description: Promotes transparent and unified national-level marketplace for agricultural produce — helps farmers across states get better prices, reduce middlemen exploitation, easier marketing.
benefits: Wider buyer base across India — better price discovery
Transparent trading, reduced exploitation by intermediaries
Better income realisation, easier sale & transport logistics
eligibility: Farmers selling produce through participating mandis / markets
Registered sellers or mandi‑members as per state rules
documents: Aadhaar, land / farm record, mandi‑seller registration if required
apply_link: Through e‑NAM portal / participating mandi / market yard registration

name: Kisan Machinery Bank / Custom Hiring Centres (as part of SMAM)
description: Allows small and marginal farmers to access farm machinery on hire via Custom Hiring Centres or Machinery Banks — so they don’t need to buy expensive equipment individually.
benefits: Affordable access to tractors, harvesters, seeders, threshers etc.
Reduces capital requirement for small/marginal farmers
Mechanises farming and increases timeliness and productivity
eligibility: Small / marginal farmers, SC/ST / women farmers under scheme norms
Farmers needing machinery temporarily, not owning equipment
documents: Identity proof (Aadhaar), land/farmer record, hiring agreement if any
apply_link: Through state / central‑supported custom‑hiring centres or agri‑machinery banks

name: Horticulture Protected Cultivation & Greenhouse Subsidy Scheme (State & Central level depending on location)
description: Subsidy support for setting up greenhouses, poly‑houses, shade nets, low tunnels etc., to grow high‑value vegetables/flowers/herbs — helps overcome harsh climate, pest issues, and get better returns.
benefits: Better yield and quality, protection from climate extremes and pests
Year‑round cultivation of high‑value crops, better income
Reduced water usage, efficient resource use
eligibility: Farmers / entrepreneurs / FPOs interested in horticulture / protected cultivation
As per guidelines of state / central horticulture subsidy scheme
documents: Aadhaar, land/farm documents, project plan, bank details
apply_link: Through horticulture department / subsidy‑portal (state or central as adopted)
status: Active (in many states including regions applicable to semi‑arid areas)

name: Cold Storage & Post‑Harvest Infrastructure Subsidy Scheme (under AIF / allied agri‑infrastructure support)
description: Supports building of cold‑storage, warehouses, sorting/grading units, pack‑houses to reduce post‑harvest losses and help farmers store produce for better prices or processing.
benefits: Reduces wastage and losses of perishable produce
Enables storage and sale when market price improves
Helps in value addition, better income stability
eligibility: Farmers, farmer groups, FPOs, agri‑entrepreneurs, cooperatives as per scheme norms
documents: Project proposal, land/lease documents, Aadhaar, bank account, necessary permissions
apply_link: Through relevant agriculture / infrastructure‑fund portals (e.g. AIF) or state-level schemes
state: All India (subject to state & project approval)

name: Value‑Addition & Agro‑Processing Subsidy Scheme
description: Support for small food processing units, processing of farm produce (fruits, vegetables, grains) — helps farmers or rural entrepreneurs to process produce for better price and reduce spoilage.
benefits: Encourages rural entrepreneurship and adds value to produce
Higher profit margin than raw produce, steady income
Reduces dependency on middle‑men, enables direct sales or brand‑creation
eligibility: Farmers / FPOs / SHGs / rural entrepreneurs engaged in agro‑processing
documents: Aadhaar, business plan / project proposal, land / lease or unit address proof, bank account
apply_link: Through central or state agro‑processing subsidy portals / department of food processing / agriculture

name: Livestock & Poultry Development Subsidy Scheme
description: Support and subsidies for poultry/goat/animal‑rearing, feed, breed improvement for farmers willing to diversify livelihood via livestock or poultry, especially as allied farming.
benefits: Subsidy on purchase of livestock / birds / improved breeds
Support for feed, veterinary care, shelter, insurance
An alternate income source besides crops, reduced risk from crop failure
eligibility: Farmers / rural households engaging in livestock/poultry rearing, as per scheme norms
documents: Aadhaar, animal ownership proof, land/household address, bank account
apply_link: Through animal‑husbandry / state‑level rural livelihood / livestock development department

name: Agri‑Credit Guarantee & Support Scheme (under AIF)
description: Through infrastructure‑funding and credit guarantee mechanisms for agri‑projects (storage, cold storage, processing units, irrigation, etc.), helps farmers and agri‑entrepreneurs get loans with lower interest/subvention and better guarantee support.
benefits: Loans up to high amount (e.g. 2 crore) with lower interest/subvention
Credit guarantee reduces the requirement for collateral security
Supports big and small agri‑projects — storage, processing, cold‑chain, irrigation
eligibility: Farmers, FPOs, cooperatives, agri‑entrepreneurs, rural SMEs as per scheme norms
documents: Project plan, land/lease documents, identity (Aadhaar), bank account, other required documents by lending institutions
apply_link: Through Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF) portal / notified banks or financial institutions
